text: Is there a way to tell if a HubSpot CMS site is hosted on an american or european server? On the particular site in question the content url’s are not referring e.g. HubSpotusercontent-eu1 or -na so i can’t really see what’s going on, but the TTFB is hella slow (1.3s) compared to some other sites we have hosted on the eu1 server which are way lower in TTFB

if you have access to the HS account it's easy to tell by taking a look at the application url:
<http://app-eu1.HubSpot.com|app-eu1.HubSpot.com> is in europe, <http://app.HubSpot.com/|app.HubSpot.com/> not
<@UV23JHEJY> Awesome (and simple), it was indeed on the american server

Hi <@U053AQUMU9E> you can create custom object from HS marketplace app
<https://app.HubSpot.com/portal-recommend/l?slug=ecosystem/marketplace/apps/sales/crm/easy-custom-objects>
Hope it will work.
Let us know if anything else.

Hi <@U052RKZN3EG> You can create a serverless function, which grabs data from the Files API, and sends it to HubDB through its API.
Then use HubDB to populate on the frontend.
This way you can further enrich the data, categories, more data and such for future filtering options.
Also, you can also simply expose the data from the serverless function’s endpoint, and use frontend JS to display it with ajax.
<@U0394M7U4QZ> Did you figure this out? Looking at the same problem here.
You can also just create it through the UI now
Can I get help with something from HubSpot slack team?
I'm leaving my org and won't be able to change password for this account or email
If anyone finds this in similar trouble, the answer was "Don't use the HubSpot SDK" :disappointed:
Why would `is unknown` come back with all companies with 0 deals associated, and `is equal to 0` comes back with no companies at all?
HubSpot doesn't populate associated number properties with 0, only blank or > 1
yeah I know bro, little annoying. Not saying it's right that it should be like that just pointing out how it is
